title: Implement consoul history command for conversation management
description:
**As a** Consoul user  
**I want** a history command to list/resume/export conversations
**So that** I can manage and revisit previous AI conversations

**Context:**
Documentation shows history subcommand (lines 287-294):
- consoul history list - List all conversations
- consoul history resume <id> - Resume a conversation
- consoul history export <id> --format markdown - Export to file

Currently no history command exists. Conversations are stored in SQLite but not accessible via CLI.

**Proposed Implementation:**

Add consoul history subcommand with:
1. list - Show all conversations with ID, date, message count, preview
2. resume <id> - Load conversation and start interactive chat
3. export <id> - Export conversation (formats: markdown, json, txt)
4. delete <id> - Delete a conversation
5. search <query> - Search conversation content
6. stats - Show usage statistics

Examples:
consoul history list
consoul history resume abc123
consoul history export abc123 --format markdown > chat.md
consoul history search "Python decorators"

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- history list shows conversations with metadata
- resume loads conversation context correctly
- export supports multiple formats (markdown, json, txt)
- delete removes conversation from database
- search finds relevant conversations
- stats shows token usage, costs, message counts

**Story Points:** 5
